channel.title: NoSQL Databases on #Define
channel.description: Recent content in NoSQL Databases on #Define

item.title: Architecture
item.description: RDMS vs NoSQL NoSQL does not store data in tables/relations and is often distributed/sharded. A NoSQL database has flexible schema. Data is stored in many ways which means it can be document-oriented, column-oriented, graph-based or organized as a KeyValue store. Sometimes called “Not only SQL” to emphasize the fact that they may support SQL-like query languages. Inherent horizontal scaling, as opposed to inherent vertical scaling in RDBMS. Complex queries like joins are very hard in NoSQL.
